title: Problem with updated version 5.0.21
body:
I have just updated to the new version 5.0.21

- ScotPlot
- ScotPlot.WinForms

Until now all updates were smooth.
This one seems to be problematic.
Please tell me what to do.

Below is a list of errors I got.

![image](https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/assets/26789352/3234eb63-cfca-4c4c-b68a-aabfe5428439)

title: SP5: How to update heatmap and colorbar
body:
I have a plot with a heatmap that I need to update when new data is loaded. It's easy enough to remove the old heatmap and create a new one. The issue I'm running into is how to update the colorbar or remove and add a new one. It seems that the only way to remove an existing colorbar is to call `Plot.Axes.Clear()`. But then that blows away all of my axes. Is there a proper way to handle this?

ScottPlot.Avalonia (5.0.21)

title: Avalonia: Call from invalid thread
SP5: Radial gauge plot
body:
Creates the radial gauge plottable, based on the v4 version.
Adds the cookbook recipes demonstrating the main features.
![image](https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/assets/63915486/bc1f90d9-8a18-46c6-a2b1-e1af6eb5d052)

There's one caveat. The line caps (`StartCap` and `EndCap` properties) functionality is severely reduced, since Skia doesn't include the `System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LineCap` options. This is commented in the submitted code in case it is owner-implemented in the future. The only functional property is `StartCap`, which only admits one of the values of the `SKStrokeCap` enum, while the `EndCap` property is ignored throughout the code.

title: SP5: Create Plot.Add.Annotation() for placing text on the figure (not bound to coordinates)
body:
Mimic the design from ScottPlot 4 https://scottplot.net/cookbook/4.1/category/plottable-annotation/

The Benchmark plot type is close to having the functionality needed, just that the label can't be set

title: AvaPlot 5.0.21 - LockVerticalAxis not working on MacOS
body:
Hi Scott,

Thanks for releasing ScottPlot. Great effort.

I'm using SP 5.0.21  with Avalonia on a Mac.  I've noticed that the API to LockVerticalAxis has changed in SP5 as its not in the Configuration object anymore. Is there a way to lock the vertical axis without having to use a key binding? Using the Candlestick plot.

I've tried setting the key binding  by casting the Interaction property to the object but doesnt seem to do anything.

```c#
((ScottPlot.Control.Interaction)GR0C0.Interaction).Inputs.LockVerticalAxisKey = ScottPlot.Control.Key.Alt;
```

Tried replacing the property but didnt do anything either. 
``` c#
var interaction = ((ScottPlot.Control.Interaction)avaPlot.Interaction);
interaction.Inputs.LockVerticalAxisKey = ScottPlot.Control.Key.Alt;
avaPlot.Interaction = interaction;
```

Is the _IPlotInteraction_ interface missing the _InputBindings_ property on purpose?

Thanks

Roger

title: Rotating text to match a trend line
body:
It would be very useful if it was possible to tie a label's rotation to the slope of plot at a particular X/Y or between two specific data points (or even between ALL data points).  This would allow developers to place labels that "follow" a line, even if the view is resized/rescaled. 

![labels](https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/assets/42001610/39060729-cf85-4597-809d-df81102ffb31)

title: Include Reset in IPlotControl
body: There is probably a technical reason that I am not aware of and this is very minor point for sure, but it seems to me that it would be helpful to have Reset() on IPlotControl, since it seems to be implemented separately on each control anyways.  This would allow us to build controls that know how to "wipe the slate clean" regardless of which platform they are implemented on.

title: Fix race condition in ScottPlot.DataViews.Wipe
body: Streamer.Data.NextIndex might get updated after it's assigned to newestCount, but before it's used when populating oldest[i], which sometimes leads to array index getting out of bounds.

title: SP4: DataStreamer.CountTotalOnLastRender not updated
body: CountTotalOnLastRender is always -1 in SP4, it's not updated in the Render method (looks like it will work in SP5, though haven't tested it).

For your Reference.
https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/assets/24189431/d01b0774-44b7-4be7-a5e9-d30403e3da7a

title: Can polygon be used as a mask?
body:
**ScottPlot Version:** 5.0.21

**Question:** Can a polygon be used as a mask?

I'm using ScottPlot to demonstrate how my [colour library](https://github.com/waacton/Unicolour) can be used with ScottPlot to generate the classic CIE xy [chromaticity diagram](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CIE_1931_color_space#CIE_xy_chromaticity_diagram_and_the_CIE_xyY_color_space), which was much easier than I expected 

![xy-plot-without-imaginary](https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/assets/3903062/901d60bf-b962-4e9e-a8f7-94c6f96fcee4)

My approach is brute force: convert every coordinate inside that black boundary to an RGB colour and draw a line around it, and that works fine. The only downside is that it's expensive to calculate if a coordinate is within that black boundary or not. My library will support it but it takes a couple of minutes for a million points.

For demonstration purposes, it would be a lot quicker for me to plot _all_ points and then use the black boundary polygon as a mask, with everything outside the boundary removed. Is this possible?

![xy-plot-with-imaginary](https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/assets/3903062/da5ac687-6911-41e9-8e6c-b712fffeccad)

I'm not even sure if it's something that a plotting library should support, but thought it was worth asking in case I missed something!

Is there a way to change axis color in a heatmap colorbar?
I found documentation for 4.1 but I can't find any information regarding this for 5.0.

title: Incomplete installation?
body:
**Issue:** I get
`MethodInvocationException: Exception calling ".ctor" with "0" argument(s): "The type initializer for 'ScottPlot.Fonts' threw an exception."`
when trying to run the sample code.
Adding the .dll seems to have worked, I got type completion for e.g. [ScottPlot.Plot] in console and when using 
`Add-Type -Path .\ScottPlot.dll -PassThru`
I see all types loaded.

**ScottPlot Version:** 5.0.21 on PowerShell 7.4.0

**Code Sample:**

```ps
Add-Type -Path .\ScottPlot.dll
$plt = [ScottPlot.Plot]::new()
```

For the install I had to add this source (line 2), otherwise it did not find the package.

```
dotnet new console
dotnet nuget add source --name nuget.org https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
dotnet add package scottplot
dotnet build
```

What am I missing? Thank you.

This should fix issues #3302 and #3280

title: SP5: Typeface was not actually cached (Critical Performance Issue)
SP5: Fix typeface caching
body:
Fixes: https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/issues/3335

Checked https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/pull/2848 and https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/issues/2419, but it seems that the issue is not actually fixed in the latest branch.
It causes critical performance issues in Linux systems.
In KUbuntu 23.10 with Avalonia 11.0.7 , the problem still exists as below:

![Screenshot_20240202_105303](https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/assets/24785749/f1ea6e30-a358-4e4a-908e-4d6b1e69ae98)

After fixing:

![Screenshot_20240202_140558](https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/assets/24785749/f2ccee85-e184-44e2-90ac-e6e2b2fd5197)

Just simply modifed the code to reach the caching goals:

```cs
// public SKTypeface Typeface => CachedTypeface ?? CreateTypeface(Name, Bold, Italic); // broken
public SKTypeface Typeface => CachedTypeface ??= CreateTypeface(Name, Bold, Italic); // works
```

title: Legend cannot display Chinese
Blazor support in SP4
body:
**Question:** 
I ran into a show stopping issue when implementing SP5 in our app. The problem I reached is that SP5 uses SkiaSharp and SkiaSharp is not supported on blazor hybrid setups. So It will not work on the app in a mobile environment I get the error "SkiaSharp currently only works on web assembly".  The issue is linked here [https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/1834](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/1834)

I am trying to figure out how to use SP4 in the blazor app but I haven't been able to find any documentation on how to set it up in a blazor file. Is this available in the repo somewhere but taken off of the website? Thanks!

**ScottPlot Version:**
4.1.71

Bar width control in pixel is not available
body: I am using ScottPlot to build a WPF project. I am using BarSeries to create a bar plot, and it is required that the bar width should be set to a fixed pixel value (the width of the bar doesn't change when the window resizes), which is not supported by version 4.x of ScottPlot. I have been trying to solve this problem for almost one day, but I have found it difficult to do so, especially when I resize the window. I suggest that if possible, you could provide a feature to set the width of a bar with a pixel value. Thank you so much.

title: SP5: refactor tick measurement
body: A SKPaint is now passed throughout the measurement system and tick font size is respected during measurements. The logic for determining tick density is now broken into its own class so it can be more easily customized and tested. #3203


Remove by type.

title: SP5: Slice Labels
body:
Pie charts currently don't support slice labels just like SP4 has. A pie chart without value/% labels is difficult to interpret. SP4 has the following available, perhaps bring SP5 to parity on this is a good first shot:
 .SliceLabels = labels
 .ShowPercentages = True
 .SliceLabelPosition = 0.62

title: SP5: Improve `Colorbar` layout and ticks
SP5: Grid needs axis-specific customization of styling
Please help with DateTimeTicks.
SP5 Grid: needs refactoring
body: The `List<IGrid>` method for storing multiple grids is probably more than we need, and it causes a weird API like `Plot.GetDefaultGrid()` to interact with common customizations. This system should be refactored to be easier to use for the 99% use case where people typically just want to customize line visibility, thickness, and color

title: hallo?
SP5: rename AxisManagers namespace
body: The `AxisManagers` namespace contains managers for plottables that modify axes, but it's unrelated to the `AxisManager` class that underlies `Plot.Axes`, so it's a confusing namespace name

title: SP5 demo: cookbook needs description textbox
body: presently only the source code is displayed

title: Copyright: remove year (2018) or replace with a range (2018-2024)?
body:
This topic is minutia, but the fact the license is dated 2018 (when this repository was first made public) made me consider what the date should be. Should it be updated every year? If there are no code changes, no, but if there are code changes in later years it seems that the copyright date should be update to reflect that, but updating license files all the time seems incorrect.

It seems MIT licensed official dotnet libraries have no date
* https://github.com/dotnet/maui/blob/main/LICENSE.txt
* https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/LICENSE.TXT

According to the [U.S. Code  401 - Notice of copyright: Visually perceptible copies](https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/17/401):
_The year date may be omitted where ... accompanying text matter ... is reproduced in ... useful articles_ which I think is covered by the date of the latest commit? I guess the git history could be modified so maybe that's not it.

I wish I knew more about this topic. I won't make any changes to the copyright notice without knowing more.

title: Markers: new plot type like `Marker` but holds a collection of points
body: I think this would be convenient to have, especially if it accepts `List<Coordinates>` and all markers would be displayed using the same style

title: OpenGL controls: hide from toolbox
body:
There's been some negative pressure leading me to consider removing the OpenGL controls from the standard package. A little more info is in #3262, but now I'm hearing that there are plot disposal issues (probably underlying issues causing #3271 to be raised which were fixed using the regular control).

To prevent breaking things, keep useful/working code intact, and prevent spinning-off even more NuGet packages, I think a good solution is to add an attribute to hide the GL controls from the toolbox. They can still be added programmatically and existing users won't experience a break, but hopefully this will steer newcomers away from it.

title: Scatter Plot SmoothTension Property takes no effect
Pie charts and a few suggestions
body:
A few suggestions:
V 5.0.16 was used.
1. In the Cookbook if you filter by "Pie" or "AddPie" it should show a quick sample. I couldn't find documentation for Pie charts (there was in v4).
2. In V4 I used to have `plt.YAxis.TickLabelFormat("#,##0,,M", dateTimeFormat:=False)`, not sure how it's now handled in V5? Couldn't find details in the docs.
3. `plt.Legend.Orientation = Orientation.Horizontal` has changed. Couldn't find how to keep this in V5.
4. `ScottPlot Demo 5.0.16.exe` has no app icon. V4 had a nice one. V4 also shows a URL to the site which is pretty useful but got lost in v5.

This is a gem of a repo!

title: How to change label format when DateTime XAxis in v5 ?
body:
Hi,

In v4 i have the following code to change the default label of datetime from iso "yyyy-mm-dd" to "MMMM" month name.

```cs
plt.XAxis.TickLabelFormat("MMMM", dateTimeFormat: true);
plt.SetCulture(CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"));
```

I don't see anythong related in the v5 cookbook and `ScottPlot.TickGenerators.DateTimeFixedInterval()` does not have a `LabelFormatter` property the [NumericAutomatic ](https://scottplot.net/cookbook/5.0/CustomizingTicks/) has.

So : Does it supported in v5 ?

Thanks for help

title: SP5 demo: rectangular selection of scatter points
body:
Such a demo would be useful for demonstrating how users can implement complex interactive functionality on their end without requiring new features to be added to ScottPlot.

Thanks to Marven from the Discord (#1966) for the idea.

title: CI: partial build on PRs to speed-up testing
body:
Using GitHub Actions building the core library, tests, and cookbook, and running the tests only takes 30 seconds.

![image](https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/assets/4165489/8dd9c470-0735-4c28-a484-30b82c8b9b02)

Building the full solution takes a really long time, most of which is retrieving workloads for building Android, MacOS, etc.

Although the full build should always be performed on merges to the main branch, maybe we can add conditional logic to the CI system to only run the full build if files in the user controls changes in PRs to speed-up that green checkmark and ability to merge and move on

title: SP5: Fix text width measurement to include leading and trailing spaces
body:
According to this [post on StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/a/77764594/13933646), the `SKPaint.MeasureText(string str, ref SKRect rect)` works as follow:

*  the returned value is the length of the text with leading and trailing white spaces
*  `rect.Left` contains the width of leading white spaces
*  `rect.width` contains the length of the text __without__ leading or trailing white spaces

This should fix issue #3223

title: SP5: Change EnableRendering to Public property #3213
body:
I have created a pull request addressing an issue related to the multi-threading support described at [https://scottplot.net/faq/async/](https://scottplot.net/faq/async/). 
According to this documentation, it is necessary to set `EnableRendering` to `false` for multi-threading purposes. However, this property is currently private.
 In this pull request, I have made the `EnableRendering` property public to resolve this issue.

title: Add a new Bar Style
body:
I would like a horizantal bar to show a device status. The device state is the state value of the time series. I need to show it like this
![image](https://github.com/ScottPlot/ScottPlot/assets/20962283/dde4cf96-fd84-4b04-ae99-58ab0d0b2a66)
The background color is set to black, and there is no need to display the Y axis, and the device status is represented by different colors or styles. Can you implement the base Bar control with different colors in the legend, and support the extension for me to achieve the latter two different styles of display.

title: SP5: Remove OpenTK
body:
OpenTK was added to allow OpenGL plottables (#2565), but OpenGL plottables have caused some confusing issues (#3008, #3007, #2950), and they have minimal performance improvements over the standard plottables. 

OpenTK throws warnings like this frequently too:

> Warning	NU1701	Package 'OpenTK 3.1.0' was restored using '.NETFramework,Version=v4.6.1, .NETFramework,Version=v4.6.2, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7.1, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7.2, .NETFramework,Version=v4.8, .NETFramework,Version=v4.8.1' instead of the project target framework 'net8.0'. This package may not be fully compatible with your project.

This issue will track removing OpenTK, FormsPlotGL, and WpfPlotGL from the standard control packages. This functionality may get added back into separate packages, or maintained here for extremely advanced users.
